cdata.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 170, Number 90 (Thursday, May 23, 2024)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. ARMSTRONG:H.R. 8516.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I Section 8 of the United States Constitution.The single subject of this legislation is:To designate the facility of the United States PostalService located at 840 Front Street in Casselton, NorthDakota, as the ``Commander Delbert Austin Olson Post Office''[Page H3523]

item.title: A bill to designate the facility of the United States Postal Service located at 840 Front Street in Casselton, North Dakota, as the "Commander Delbert Austin Olson Post Office".

item.text: Ordered to be Reported by Voice Vote.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held
Referred to the House Committee on Oversight and Accountability.

item.title: H.R. 8516, a bill to designate the facility of the United States Postal Service located at 840 Front Street in Casselton, North Dakota, as the â€œCommander Delbert Austin Olson Post Office
item.description: As ordered reported by the House Committee on Oversight and Accountability on September 18, 2024

cdata.text: This bill designates the facility of the United States Postal Service located at 840 Front Street in Casselton, North Dakota, as the "Commander Delbert Austin Olson Post Office".

bill.title: To designate the facility of the United States Postal Service located at 840 Front Street in Casselton, North Dakota, as the "Commander Delbert Austin Olson Post Office".

item.title: To designate the facility of the United States Postal Service located at 840 Front Street in Casselton, North Dakota, as the "Commander Delbert Austin Olson Post Office".
To designate the facility of the United States Postal Service located at 840 Front Street in Casselton, North Dakota, as the "Commander Delbert Austin Olson Post Office".

latestAction.text: Ordered to be Reported by Voice Vote.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
